page.title: 01CASTLE BYTHAM.
page.content: Castle Bytham is situated almost mid-way between Stamford and Grantham and about 3 miles east of the A1 trunk road.It is a small compact village built mainly around the castle mound.It has been designated a conservation area for some time.As will be seen from the land cover survey much of the block is given over to mixed farming, mainly arable together with sheep and a few cattle.St.James church is the oldest building still existing parts of which date from 1115.Close by the church is the school .This is a Junior, Infant school taking children up to the age of 11 years.In 1985 there were 45 pupils in all.There are two public houses _The Fox & Hounds and The Castle.In Pinfold road there is a village shop with a Post Office .
